questions.question: 1. In a sequence diagram, what is the primary purpose of a 'lifeline'?

answers.a: To represent the sequence of events in chronological order
answers.b: To show the duration of an object's existence
answers.d: To depict the flow of data between objects

questions.question: 2.Which of the following statements is true about drawing time sequence diagrams?

answers.a: A time sequence diagram is used to visualize the interactions between objects in a system over a period of time.
answers.b: A time sequence diagram is used to show the structural relationships between objects in a system.
answers.c: A time sequence diagram is used to illustrate the flow of control within a single object in a system.
answers.d: A time sequence diagram is used to document the architecture of a system.

questions.question: 3.When drawing a time sequence diagram, which of the following statements is true?

answers.a: The vertical axis represents the objects involved in the system, while the horizontal axis represents time.
answers.b: The vertical axis represents time, while the horizontal axis represents the objects involved in the system.
answers.c: The vertical axis represents the messages exchanged between objects, while the horizontal axis represents time.
answers.d: The vertical axis represents the messages exchanged between objects, while the horizontal axis represents time.
